intro: Carpesium nepalense var. ciliatum, commonly known as the Nepal thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan regions of Nepal and northern India. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky and mountainous habitats, thriving at high altitudes. Its leaves are covered in fine hairs and have a distinctive ciliate margin, giving it its botanical name. The species produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months, attracting various pollinators.
